caption:
This photograph depicts a sunny residential scene, likely from the mid-20th century, showcasing a row of townhouses with a brick facade. The architecture of the townhouses is uniform, featuring a two-story design with pairs of white-framed windows on both levels and small white doors that are likely entries to individual units.

In front of the townhouses, there's a neatly maintained street with a vintage car parked along the curb. The car is large, likely an American make from the 1950s or 1960s, with a distinctive shiny, metallic body and prominent tailfins.

The landscaping includes well-manicured lawns and vibrant flower beds with a variety of blooms in pinks, yellows, and whites. A centrally placed rectangular flower bed is closer to the foreground, with a flower-lined curved path leading around it. In the background, a street lamp and more greenery are visible, suggesting a community-focused, pedestrian-friendly environment.

Overall, the scene captures a quiet, residential area with attention to gardening and exterior upkeep, reflecting suburban life in this era.
title: Yacht Club Cove on Staten Island: an "environmental" community of cluster housing around a central open space designed to preserve land values
